title: Facebook's fact-checking program to reportedly exempt opinion and satire
text: The social network relies on third-party fact checkers to flag misinformation.

title: Facebook initially argued that proposed FTC fine was 'excessive' and 'unconstitutional'
text: The social network fought back against a fine related to the Cambridge Analytica data scandal.

title: The Wall Street Journal: Facebook to exempt opinion pieces, satire from its fact-checking rules
text: Facebook Inc. plans to exempt opinion pieces and satire from its fact-checking program, according to people familiar with the matter, as the social-media giant grapples with how to stop the spread of falsehoods while maintaining its own neutrality.

title: The family of the Facebook employee who committed suicide has hired a law firm to investigate
text: A law firm representing the family of the Facebook employee who committed suicide this month announced it is conducting an investigation into the circumstances of the death.

title: 3 Tech Stocks to Sell In October
text: These three tech giants have quickly become ideal stocks to sell in October. Here's what you need to know about each of these tech stocks.

title: How Facebook's Upcoming News Tab Will Work
text: The social networking giant is paying some publishers in an effort to combat fake news.

title: Facebook Faces Real Political Risk From Libra Cryptocurrency
text: Facebook Inc. (NASDAQ:FB) made a big public splash in June when it unveiled Libra Blockchain , its self-described cryptocurrency.

title: Facebook bans charity breast cancer awareness video over nudity
text: Facebook has banned an educational video about breast cancer over nudity concerns.

title: MobileIron's UEM Expertise to Aid Oculus Manage Data Security
text: MobileIron's (MOBL) UEM solutions will enable Facebook's (FB) Oculus for Business to transform workspace with improved productivity and data security.

title: Facebook Stock Can’t Gain Traction as DOJ Report Extends Probe List
text:
With Facebook already undergoing an antitrust probe by the FTC, FB stock slipped on reports the DOJ is launching a parallel investigation.
